We're going to start with looking at a covered call for context. The assumption here is that you already generally know what this is. But if you don't, I'll give you a quick recap. A covered call typically means we're going to have the same overall delta potential for long and short delta's. So in this case, we have a one to one or a two to two reduced down one to one. So this is long 200 shares of Tesla and short two calls. So what this means is we have a maximum of long 200 delta's from our shares and then a maximum of negative 200 delta's from the short calls. And that leads to this right here. So something I might do to that example would be sell to in the 13 Jan, two in the 20 Jan, two in the 27 Jan or one in the 27 Jan or zero in the 27 Jan. It depends on how you want to spread them out. But essentially, I would want to make sure I have at least 100 shares uncovered. So, but to keep it closer to an apples to apples comparison, I'm not going to say, I'm not going to do any of that. I'm going to pick our very same short call here and instead of selling five, we're literally just going to sell four, maybe three, if you're super bullish in this case, I was, but again, to keep it to a closer non preferential look back, I'm going to say that we sold four. But if I'm trading something like a covered call or a ratio covered call, this is what I want to see. This is the scenario I'm attempting to expose myself to. So that's why I selected this one. The main trade off here is if the opposite happened and we moved down, I just would have collected less money up front. So that's the trade off here. You can either have much greater profit potential if you use uncovered or I don't use uncovered because that's kind of synonymous with naked short calls. But in this case, they're covered because you have the underlying, but you're selling them out of ratio. You're just uncovering your upside potential. So the ratio covered call favors giving us upside potential, but it finds a balance between upside potential, but still collecting enough money up front. Because in this scenario, you essentially just collected 500 less because it's one lot less, but you unlocked significantly more profit potential if you get the big move that you think might happen.
